snippet: Afghan officials said the attacker, a member of a highly regarded police force working with the British in Helmand Province, had opened fire after an argument.
abstract: Western and Afghan officials say that a member of a highly regarded Afghan police force opened fire on British soldiers during an argument, killing three of them as they left a meeting with local elders in southern Afghanistan; Afghan soldiers and police officers have attacked their American and allied counterparts with increasing frequency in recent years.

byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah contributed reporting from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Alan Cowell from London.

lead_paragraph: Afghan officials said the attacker, a member of a highly regarded police force working with the British in Helmand Province, had opened fire after an argument.

headline.main: Three British Soldiers Killed by Afghan Officer
headline.print_headline: Three British Soldiers Killed by Afghan Officer
